strategy: Replace the gradient-boosted tree ensemble with a neural network model (e.g., a dense feedforward network) using fully connected layers with ReLU activations. Instead of target encoding, apply frequency-based encoding for categorical variables (e.g., encoding class as a count of passengers per class) and introduce polynomial features of age and fare (e.g., age², fare×age) to capture non-linear interactions. Normalize all inputs using z-score standardization and apply dropout layers to reduce overfitting. This approach leverages deep non-linear function approximation, moving beyond tree-based splits to model complex, high-dimensional patterns in survival probability.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.preprocessing import PolynomialFeatures

test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

test_df['Pclass_freq'] = test_df['Pclass'].map(train_df['Pclass'].value_counts())

test_df['Sex_freq'] = test_df['Sex'].map(train_df['Sex'].value_counts())

test_df['FamilySize'] = test_df['SibSp'] + test_df['Parch'] + 1

test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
